alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 22 at 1:50AM MDT until August 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Forecasted Today... .Hot and dry conditions continue today across the Tri-State area. A similar patter to yesterday, albeit a little further east. A corridor of lower dew points will move north into the area with SW winds occurring. This along with temperatures in the upper 90s to low 100s will cause RH values to fall into the low to mid teens. Winds will also be breezy to gusty from sunrise through sunset, the relative more favorable time for the strongest wind gusts will be during the mid to late morning hours where gusts around 45 mph may occur. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT /NOON CDT/ THIS MORNING TO 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001,013 IN KANSAS, 079 in Nebraska and 252,253 IN COLORADO... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM MDT /noon CDT/ this morning to 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy, Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma and Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 12 percent. * TEMPERATURES... Upper 90s to low 100s * IMPACTS... Any fires that start today will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning or any activity that involves sparks is not advised. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... There is a low chance for dry thunderstorms to develop across portions of Kit Carson and Yuma counties during the afternoon. Dry lightning would be a possibility and would further enhance fire start potential.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
